paragraphs.text: State of the Union: Advice for Joni Ernst.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Here's a suggestion for Joni Ernst, the new Republican senator from Iowa
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who will deliver the GOP response to the State of the Union address Tuesday night
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Get a chorus together and open with this old Sammy Cahn-Jule Styne number:"It seems to me I've heard that song before; it's from an old familiar score, I know it well, that melody."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Advance leaks of the president's address indicate he will call for higher taxes on the wealthy and successful in order to pay for programs for the poor and middle class
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This is boilerplate Democratic wealth redistribution we've heard since New Deal days
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which appeals more to emotions than it does to principles with a long history of success
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since the advent of modern "anti-poverty" programs 50 years ago, according to an analysis by The Heritage Foundation, "U.S  taxpayers have spent over $22 trillion on anti-poverty programs."
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: And yet the poverty rate remains essentially unchanged
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One might conclude then that if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you've spent 50 years and $22 trillion trying without success to fix something
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: perhaps you're doing it wrong and should try a different approach
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the goal is more successful people who can take care of themselves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: incentives must be put in place to encourage people to make right decisions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First on any anti-poverty help-the-middle-class list must be a stable family life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A two-parent home where adults love and are committed to each other and in which their children feel loved creates a climate in which moral and economic values like hard work, self-control, personal responsibility and accountability flourish
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To help achieve this, parents must be educated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they must have jobs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Government can make this easier by reforming the tax code to remove the "marriage penalty," which in too many instances charges higher taxes to married couples than to singles, and increasing the exemption deductible for children, which might make it possible for one parent to stay home with young children; allow college tuition to be deductible to incentivize more people to obtain a college education and ease their debt upon graduation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Better yet, scrap the tax code entirely and replace it with a flat tax or consumption tax that allows people to save, invest and spend more of the money they earn
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Economically, there must be a change in attitude from working to pay bills, to working to build wealth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Bills, like the poor, we will always have with us, but in building wealth one moves toward independence and personal satisfaction that pays dividends in liberty and personal choice
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Government should also make it easier for people to move in pursuit of new opportunities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My late grandfather worked for the B and O Railroad for 50 years
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He retired with a pension, a gold-plated watch and a lifetime train pass
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Those days are long gone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: People need to be ready to move to places in pursuit of opportunities that can bring economic and career growth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Earning more produces more in taxable income and more income means more tax money for federal and state treasuries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My wife and I have moved eight times (so far) and each move provided new opportunities, more experience and eventually higher incomes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Here's another suggestion for Sen  Ernst and the new Republican Congress
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Let the Democrats focus on misery, poverty and failure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You promote hope, opportunity and achievement
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Begin featuring people with stories to tell of how they overcame difficult circumstances -- from poverty, welfare, addiction, single motherhood, and so on -- and are now independent, strong and if not prosperous, then at least free of their addiction to government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Leaders should inspire others to follow examples of people who have succeeded in life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Democrats' mantra has been that the poor and middle class can't succeed without government help
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that were true
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the money spent on programs aimed at the poor and middle class would have succeeded by now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's long past time for a new direction and for a new "song" with different words
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the month we observe the birthday of Martin Luther King Jr , how about "We HAVE overcome"?
paragraphs.label: assumption
